text: taken from notes, pour at Zythos 2015. Pours dark brown with a small head. Nose is a tad too alcoholic, especially compared to the Original pannepeut. Nutty and date aromas.
Bottle at Craigs. 2010 vintage. Pours clear red-brown with no head. Aromas of dark sugar, some wood. Taste is dark sugars. Thin finish. Some heat still, boozy.

330 ml bottle. 2010 vintage. Pours a deep brown with reddish hints. Aromas of sweet malts, candi sugar, and old sour dough with a bit if copper. Big malty and bready yeasty flavors as an extension to of the Pannepot with smooth vanilla and dried caramel notes. Wunderbar

ath zythos beer festival along with Yves black dark brown colored body with a small off white head and roasted malt fruity hop aroma a roasted malt hop sweet fruity alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

(draught) hazy deep brown colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of green apple and acetone, with a light hint of brown sugar, roasted malts, yeast and grilled meat. flavour is mostly brown sugar, coconut and acetone, rather sweet, with some more green apple, caramel, earth and a light-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

sample from draft at ZBF 15, poured a dark brown to black colour with a oily tanned legg on the side. first notice is the bourbon, dark roasted malts, chocolate, raisins, marzipan, oak, tannis, vanilla, sweet smoky bourbon, liqorice, campfired marshmallow, sweet bourbon finish, more notice of dark fruits after its starts to warm a little bit. boy this is so good. ive lost some trust in struise the last year, but boy, these cask strength beers are incredible, and just the way that i like it! maybe I like this even better than the old pannepot reservas! please make more pannepot on bourbon instead of bordeaux! incredible! best beer of the festival

At ZBF 15. Thnx for sharing, everyone ! Pours unclear, very dark brown. Smell is sharpm bourbon. Taste is sharp, very grainy bourbon . Pannepeut in the back, but the bourbon does overpower in this one

Shared with wim at Zythos bierfestival 2015. Dark brown colored beer with small off-white head and no carbonation. Fruited wint alcoholic aroma. Full slightly sparkling palate. Finish is fruited winey ending malty sweet. Nice

On tap Reserva 2013 at Alvinne Craft Beer Fest in Vichte - Belgium March 2015 with markoijelena. Pours dark amber semi-filtered with just some phenomena of bubbles on the surface. Nose: wood, sweet and fresh red fruit, Perfect! Mouth: molasses, under spirit fruit, never disturbing. Balanced and great!
Sampled draft @ ACBF 2015. 2013 Vintage. Just when I thought Struise was out, they pulled me back in. Vanilla, bourbon, maybe too sweet to finish a bottle, but what an explosion.

6/III/15 - on tap @ ACBF 2015 (Vichte) - BB: n/a (2015-283) Thanks to all for sharing todays beers!
Clear purple brown beer, small to no head. Aroma: banana, sweet, lots of raisins, caramel, sugary, some milk chocolate. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet, caramel, bit sugary, little alcoholic, chemical touch, very spicy, raisins. Aftertaste: little hoppy, sweet, caramel, sugary, dried fruits, little chemical, vanilla, something off but barely detectable (so 8 instead of 9 for flavour).
At Alvinne 2015. Poured deep dark brown with a small beige ring. Aroma of vanilla, roast malt, booze. Full body, flavour is toffee sweetness, boozy bitterness.

Draft sample Reserva 2013 at Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015 Vichte Belgium.Pour it dark color with small white head.Taste and aroma of bourbon, dark fruits strong flavour, vanilla, apple, pear.Perfect balanced.One of the best beers we tried at the festival for me.
@ ACBF 2015. Dark brown/black colour, dark brown foam. Soft carbonation. Oily texture. Aroma of roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla, caramel. Full body. Bit on the sweet side but ok!

Draught at Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015. 
Hazy dark brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of oak.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, dried fruits, licorice and marzipan.
Sweet finish.

Sample at ACBF 2015 with S&G tasting group.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, almost no head.
NOSE: oak, alcohol, malts, fruity.
TASTE: oak, alcohol, malts, fruity, bad chemical kind of aftertaste. What happened?

07/03/2015 form tap @ ACBF 2015, Vichte. Thanks to Pieter for sharing.
Hazy dark brown with light tanned head. Aroma is dark fruits, alcohol, marzipan. Taste is licorice, dark fruits, alcohol. I always preferred Pannepeut more than Pannepot and I think its the same with the reserva. Not my favorite Struise but again a very good one.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is dry phenolic and slight estery. Sweet malty, breadish and roasted. Dry and toasted.

Draft sample @ ACBF 2015. 
Ambrée, col beige, doré au verre. Malté gardant cette approche très belge et un profil Struise. Sucré moyen avec cette impression de sous-bois, feuillu. Pointe dépice et fine note de levure. Une version solide mais un cran en dessous de loriginale. Lajout et murissage en fut de Bourbon confère à cette bière une autre dimension qui se marie parfaitement au caractère très belge de cette bière notamment dans lusage des malts et du sucre candis.. Cest par ailleurs une sorte de hit or miss avec le programme de barrique de Struise, dans ce dernier cas, la bière est une réussite.

Sampled draft @ ACBF 2015. 2013 Vintage. Dark brown with basically no head. Thick liquorish, sweet sugary, extremely thick dark fruits & lots of vanilla bourbon sweetness; Taste is thick warming liquorish, bourbon, real spirit-character, thick dark fruits, Thick body coats the mouth. Warming. After some disappointing stuff now there is this & holly crap is it good. Why didnt they make this sooner? (Thanks for sharing people!!!)
